label.tool_tip: Order of airfoils in which to write the coordinates, separated by commas

Additional lines to add to the start of the coordinate file.
Use the newline character '\n' to create line breaks

Airfoil separator line(s). Use the newline character '\n' to
create line breaks. Leave unchanged to make a single newline
character the airfoil separator
Coordinate delimiter. Leave unchanged for space-delimited coordinates
Select the directory in which to store the airfoil coordinate file

File name under which to store the coordinates.
Use the JSON extension (.json) to save in the JSON file format.
Otherwise, the coordinates will be stored in a DAT-style format.
Note that the delimiter, separator, and header fields will be ignored
if the JSON extension is used
Downsample the airfoil coordinates based on the curvature

checkbox.tool_tip: Downsample the airfoil coordinates based on the curvature

label.tool_tip: Maximum number of airfoil coordinates allowed

spinbox.tool_tip: Maximum number of airfoil coordinates allowed

label.tool_tip: Importance of curvature in the downsampling scheme. Values close to 0 place high emphasis on curvature, while values close to positive infinity place no emphasis on curvature and leave the parameter vector effectively uniformly spaced

spinbox.tool_tip: Importance of curvature in the downsampling scheme. Values close to 0 place high emphasis on curvature, while values close to positive infinity place no emphasis on curvature and leave the parameter vector effectively uniformly spaced
